result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dontray Cornelius Turner

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner not in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerald Kerska in court for Dontray Cornelius Turner.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense filed motions to suppress. Court set a motion hearing date.  Court ordered State to respond by 1-05-2023.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Court rescheduled scheduling conference set for 9-16-2022 at 1:30 pm upon request from the defense.  Parties notified of new date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence Seized from Unlawful Traffic Stop, filed
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence Seized From Unlawful Search, filed by defense

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner not in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerald Kerska in court for Dontray Cornelius Turner.  Attorney Alexandria Carlson in court on behalf of Samuel E. Simpson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court acknowledges requests for substitution which is approved. Defense requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned for a scheduling conference Branch 40.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Gerald Kerska in court in person for Dontray Cornelius Turner.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #22CF2282 and Waukesha case #21CF1019.  Sworn for the State: West Allis PD Officer M. Lazaris. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Adjustment Number: 22A 082025,
Payable Number: 1028415,
Receipt Number: 22RP034449,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
